resources.string: If you find Wi-Fi is disabled while adding a new network, or is otherwise toggled too often, you can increase the timeout before it is turned off.
Turning off notifications may impact the background service in low memory conditions, if you notice problems, leave it on.
Automatically start Smarter Wi-Fi Manager service on boot or Wi-Fi and cell tower changes.
Control Wi-Fi radio based on auto-learned locations and other criteria
Automatically learn when to enable Wi-Fi based on cell tower identities. To begin learning in a new location, enable Wi-Fi normally.
While connected to an ignored SSID, automatic location learning will be disabled. It will be re-enabled when you leave the blocked network.
Cell tower identifiers are mapped to Wi-Fi network names in auto-learn mode. If a network is turning on at inappropriate times, removing its entry will reset that networks state.

Deleting a learned network will reset all associations to known towers. If auto-learning is enabled, the network will begin learning towers again. To disable auto-learning for a network, set the network to "ignore" in the Ignore tab
Wi-Fi and auto-learning will be disabled while connected to blacklisted Bluetooth devices.

Ignoring a network will not automatically delete the learned locations. You can delete them now or via the Learning tab, or you can leave them if you wish to continue enabling Wi-Fi based on known positions, but do not want to learn additional new locations.
Fixed time ranges override other control methods and allow enabling or disabling radios within a time period.
